description: go.tools/go/types: fix interface vs interface type assertion

messages.text:
Hello adonovan@google.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go.tools

On 2013/08/02 21:26:37, gri wrote:
> Hello mailto:adonovan@google.com (cc: mailto:golang-dev@googlegroups.com),
> 
> I'd like you to review this change to
> https://code.google.com/p/go.tools

LGTM

https://codereview.appspot.com/12378043/diff/8001/go/types/lookup.go
File go/types/lookup.go (right):

https://codereview.appspot.com/12378043/diff/8001/go/types/lookup.go#newcode233
go/types/lookup.go:233: // An interface type implements T if it has no methods with conflicting signatures.
"An interface type implements T..." isn't correct. What you want to say is something like: an interface type *could* implement T, and is thus permitted to appear in a type assert/switch, if ....

https://codereview.appspot.com/12378043/diff/8001/go/types/lookup.go
File go/types/lookup.go (right):

https://codereview.appspot.com/12378043/diff/8001/go/types/lookup.go#newcode233
go/types/lookup.go:233: // An interface type implements T if it has no methods with conflicting signatures.
On 2013/08/02 21:28:28, adonovan wrote:
> "An interface type implements T..." isn't correct. What you want to say is
> something like: an interface type *could* implement T, and is thus permitted to
> appear in a type assert/switch, if ....
> 

Done.

*** Submitted as https://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=abb36107ee00&repo=tools ***

go.tools/go/types: fix interface vs interface type assertion

R=adonovan
CC=golang-dev
https://codereview.appspot.com/12378043

subject: code review 12378043: go.tools/go/types: fix interface vs interface type assertion
